Package cams.view.base

Class TextBox

java.lang.Object
cams.view.base.TextBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
Displayable
public class TextBox extends Object implements Displayable
Base class for user interface elements which requests user input. This base class enables this application to retrieve and store user input which may be further processed by classes containing this base class. This base text box is used by association in this application.

To use this base text box, construct this base class with its label.

Since:
2023-11-09
Version:
1.0
Author:
Gillbert Susilo Wong, Juan Frederick, Karl Devlin Chau, Pascalis Pandey, Trang Nguyen

  • Constructor Details

    • TextBox

      public TextBox(String label, Scanner scanner)
      Constructs a labelled text box and the scanner to be used to receive user input. The ID attached to this text box is the label. Label should be descriptive of what is required from the user.
      Parameters:
      label - text box label
      scanner - scanner for this text box

    • TextBox

      public TextBox(String id, String label, Scanner scanner)
      Constructs a labelled text box and the scanner to be used to receive user input, with ID attached to the text box. Label should be descriptive of what is required from the user.
      Parameters:
      id - text box id
      label - text box label
      scanner - scanner for this text box

    • TextBox

      public TextBox(String label, boolean inputHidden, Scanner scanner)
      Constructs a labelled text box where the user input can be hidden and the scanner to be used to receive user input. The ID attached to this text box is the label. Label should be descriptive of what is required from the user. An example where user input may want to be hidden is when asking for the user's password.
      Parameters:
      label - text box label
      inputHidden - disables input echoing if true
      scanner - scanner for this text box

    • TextBox

      public TextBox(String id, String label, boolean inputHidden, Scanner scanner)
      Constructs a labelled text box where the user input can be hidden and the scanner to be used to receive user input, with ID attached to the text box. Label should be descriptive of what is required from the user. An example where user input may want to be hidden is when asking for the user's password.
      Parameters:
      id - id of this text box; mainly used to get this text box's value within a Form
      label - text box label
      inputHidden - disables input echoing if true
      scanner - scanner for this text box

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public String getId()
      Retrieves text box ID. This ID can be used by Form as the key to access the text box's value.
      Returns:
      text box ID

      public String getValue()
      Retrieves text box value/user input.
      Returns:

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays text box label to the standard output and gets user input in the same line using the provided scanner of the text box.
